intro: Myrsine umbellata, commonly known as the clustered myrsine, is a tropical flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including the Philippines, Indonesia, and Malaysia. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, giving the plant its scientific name.
